wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the School-Management-System. Explain its purpose as a full-stack role-based school administration platform serving administrators, teachers, students, and parents. Describe the high-level architecture combining Next.js frontend, Supabase backend, and PostgreSQL database with Row Level Security. Document the core features including attendance tracking, grade management, assignment submission, calendar integration, parent-teacher communication, and Zoom meeting integration. Include conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers about the component organization, routing structure, and authentication flow. Use terminology consistent with the codebase such as 'admin dashboard', 'teacher portal', 'student analytics', and 'parent monitoring'. Provide practical examples of user workflows for each role and illustrate key concepts with system context diagrams.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the component architecture of the School-Management-System. Explain the two-tier component system comprising reusable UI primitives from shadcn/ui in components/ui/ and custom business components in the root components/ directory. Document how UI components follow Headless UI principles with unstyled, accessible foundations styled via Tailwind CSS. Detail the implementation of key business components like dashboard-header.tsx, dashboard-sidebar.tsx, data-table.tsx, and role-specific guards like admin-session-guard.tsx. Describe component composition patterns used throughout the application, such as the dashboard layout structure shared across roles. Include examples of how pages compose multiple business components to create feature-rich interfaces. Address accessibility implementation, responsive design considerations, and performance optimization techniques like lazy loading and code splitting. Provide guidance on creating new components following existing patterns and conventions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin Dashboard
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Admin Dashboard focused on its role as the central management interface for school administrators. Explain its purpose in user management (students, teachers, parents), class administration, attendance oversight, grade monitoring, and system auditing. Detail the architecture using Next.js Server Components and client-side interactivity with React hooks. Document the layout structure with dashboard-sidebar and dashboard-header components, and describe data fetching patterns using use-optimized-query hook. Include practical examples of common workflows such as creating a new class, enrolling a student, or reviewing audit logs. Illustrate integration points with Supabase via API routes in app/api/admin/ directory. Address security considerations including role-based access control and audit logging. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like failed user creation or data loading errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: App Directory Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the app/ directory in the School-Management-System. Explain how the Next.js App Router organizes role-based dashboards for admin, teacher, student, and parent roles, with each having dedicated routes and layout files. Detail the structure of server components and client interactions, highlighting the use of loading.tsx for UX optimization. Describe the API routes under app/api/ as backend entry points handling authentication, user management, academic operations, and Zoom integration. Document the routing logic, middleware usage via Supabase auth, and data fetching patterns using server-side functions. Provide practical examples such as how the admin/classes/page.tsx fetches class data via lib/supabase/queries and renders it using components/data-table.tsx. Include guidance on adding new pages and API endpoints following existing patterns, ensuring alignment with role-based access control.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Security
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on authentication security in the School-Management-System. Thoroughly explain the implementation of Supabase Auth with secure password hashing, session binding via fingerprinting, and MFA support. Document the forced password change mechanism (`must_change_password`) and account deactivation (`is_active`) features. Include code examples from `session-security.ts` showing session creation, validation, and invalidation workflows. Explain how client fingerprints are generated and validated to prevent session hijacking. Describe the single-session enforcement policy and device tracking via `user_devices` table. Address common issues such as expired sessions, suspicious login attempts, and recovery procedures. Provide configuration options for session timeout and security strictness. Highlight integration with Next.js server components and cookie-based session management.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for all backend endpoints in the School-Management-System. Document each RESTful route grouped by role (admin, teacher, student, parent) and functional domain (user management, attendance, grades, etc.). For each endpoint, specify HTTP method, URL pattern, request body schema, query parameters, response format, authentication requirements, and error codes. Include real-world usage examples from the codebase such as creating a class via POST /api/admin/create-class or submitting attendance via POST /api/teacher/attendance/save. Explain the middleware chain including authentication and role validation. Document API versioning strategy, rate limiting implementation, and error handling patterns using lib/api-errors.ts. Address security considerations like input sanitization, CSRF protection, and audit logging for sensitive operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Admin API endpoints in the School-Management-System. Document all RESTful routes under app/api/admin/ including user management (create-user, get-users, toggle-user-status), class operations (create-class, classes, [id]), student enrollment (enroll-student, unenroll-student), parent-child linking (link-parent-child, unlink-parent-child), and academic data access (grades, quizzes, schedule). For each endpoint, specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas using types from lib/supabase/types.ts, authentication requirements (admin role verification), and example payloads. Include detailed descriptions of error responses (401 Unauthorized, 403 Forbidden, 429 Too Many Requests) and security measures such as rate limiting and RLS enforcement. Explain the DTO pattern used for data sanitization and pagination implementation in list endpoints. Provide usage examples from frontend components like student-form.tsx and admin-session-guard.tsx. Document the settings update flow and its impact on system-wide configurations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layout Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for layout components in the School-Management-System. Describe the structure and behavior of dashboard-header and dashboard-sidebar used across role-based dashboards. Document their props, responsive design patterns, and integration with Next.js App Router. Explain how theme-provider enables dynamic theme switching and integrates with Tailwind CSS. Include usage examples showing navigation state management and mobile responsiveness. Address accessibility compliance including keyboard navigation and screen reader support. Provide guidelines for extending the layout with new navigation items or branding elements.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the User model in the School-Management-System. Detail the field definitions including id, email, name, role, avatar, phone, address, is_active, and must_change_password with their respective data types and constraints. Explain the primary key (id) and unique constraint on email. Document the Row Level Security (RLS) policies that govern access based on user roles (admin, teacher, student, parent). Describe the relationship between the users table and role-specific profiles (student, teacher, parent). Include the TypeScript interfaces DbUser from lib/supabase/types.ts and the corresponding database schema from lib/database.types.ts. Explain the business rules such as role-based permissions, account activation, and password reset requirements. Provide examples of common queries for user lookup, role verification, and status checks. Address data validation rules enforced at both database and application levels.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the User Management sub-feature of the Admin Dashboard. Document the data flow from UI components (student-form.tsx) to API routes handling user creation, status toggling, and listing. Include concrete examples from the codebase such as form submission handling in create-user/route.ts and real-time user list rendering using use-optimized-query. Explain relationships with Supabase authentication system and RLS policies in database migrations. Address common issues like failed user creation due to validation constraints or role misassignment, and provide solutions. Make content accessible to beginners while detailing advanced patterns like optimized querying and error handling via api-errors.ts.

Address common issues like missing grade data or delayed updates, and provide troubleshooting steps. wiki_catalogs.name: Users Table and Role-Based Access
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the users table, detailing its structure with fields such as id, email, name, role (admin, teacher, student, parent), is_active, and must_change_password. wiki_catalogs.name: Users and Authentication

wiki_catalogs.name: Login Endpoint
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the POST /api/auth/login endpoint. Document the request body schema including email, password, and optional MFA token. Document endpoints for retrieving calendar events (GET /api/calendar) and managing individual events (GET, PUT, DELETE /api/calendar/[id]). Specify request/query parameters for filtering by date range, user role, and event type (class, meeting, deadline). Detail response schema including event title, start/end times, location (physical or Zoom link), and associated metadata. Explain authentication requirements and role-based visibility rules enforced via Supabase RLS. Describe integration with Zoom API for virtual meetings and iCal export capabilities. Reference usage in calendar-view.tsx and event creation workflows in meeting-attendance-summary.tsx. Highlight data consistency mechanisms, time zone handling using date-fns, and real-time synchronization across user dashboards. Address recurring event support, conflict detection, and permissions for event modification based on ownership and role.

wiki_catalogs.name: Webhook Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Zoom webhook endpoint POST /api/zoom/webhook. Detail the event-driven architecture that listens for Zoom lifecycle events (e.g., meeting.started, meeting.ended) and processes them in real-time. Document the request schema using ZoomWebhookEvent interface from lib/zoom/types.ts, including event types, timestamps, and payload structure with meeting and participant data. Explain the HMAC signature verification process using ZOOM_WEBHOOK_SECRET to ensure request authenticity, and the event routing logic that updates internal meeting status and triggers notifications. Describe integration with internal systems such as attendance tracking upon meeting start and gradebook updates after sessions. Include error handling for invalid signatures, retry mechanisms for failed processing, and logging via audit-monitor.ts. Provide examples of handling meeting start events to auto-mark attendance and end events to generate session reports.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Layer Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the security integration in MFA flows. Describe how the getClientIp and validateOrigin functions from lib/security.ts enhance the security of MFA operations. Explain the role of IP hashing for audit logging and abuse detection. Document how these utilities are used in the login route to prevent CSRF and rate limiting attacks. Discuss the importance of secure session handling, including session binding with client fingerprints and secure cookie policies. Include threat models addressed, such as session hijacking, replay attacks, and credential stuffing. Provide examples from the codebase showing security middleware patterns and error handling strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Security Mechanisms
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for session security mechanisms. Explain how session binding is implemented using cryptographic fingerprints derived from client device characteristics via fingerprint.ts. Document the storage and validation of session tokens in secure, HTTP-only cookies with appropriate SameSite and Secure flags. Describe the server-side session tracking table created in session_security.sql, including fields for user_id, token_hash, device_info, ip_address (hashed), created_at, and expires_at. Cover the use of rate limiting and audit logging for suspicious session activities. Explain how invalidateAllUserSessions works to revoke active sessions during password changes or security events. Include threat models addressed: session hijacking, replay attacks, CSRF, and brute-force attempts. Provide guidance on rotating secrets and maintaining forward secrecy.

wiki_catalogs.name: Meeting Update
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for Zoom meeting updates (PATCH /api/zoom/meetings/[id]). Document the HTTP PATCH method, URL pattern with meeting ID parameter, request body schema supporting partial updates of title, description, startTime, duration, timezone, classId, targetAudience, and settings. Specify the response format with the updated meeting object. Explain the authentication and authorization requirements (JWT token with ownership or admin privileges). Detail the implementation flow: verification of meeting existence, permission checks (host or admin), synchronization between internal database and Zoom API via updateZoomMeeting, and database update with proper field mapping. Include error handling for Zoom API failures, database errors, and permission denials. Provide usage examples from zoom-meeting-dialog.tsx showing edit form patterns. Address data consistency considerations and the importance of updating both systems transactionally.

wiki_catalogs.name: Attendance Breakdown Chart
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Attendance Breakdown Chart within the ProgressAnalytics component. Explain its implementation using Recharts PieChart to visualize attendance patterns. Document the data processing logic that categorizes attendance records into present, late, absent, and excused counts. Detail the pie chart configuration including inner and outer radius, padding angle, and color mapping for each status type. Describe the legend implementation using colored indicators and count labels. Explain the responsive design considerations and tooltip customization for data clarity. Provide examples of how parents monitor attendance trends and administrators identify chronic absenteeism. Address accessibility features such as keyboard navigation between segments and ARIA labels for screen readers. Include troubleshooting guidance for edge cases like zero attendance records, color contrast issues, and inaccurate percentage calculations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Meeting Ended Event
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive content for the meeting.ended webhook event processing. Detail how the system updates the meeting status to 'ended' in the database and processes all participants still marked as 'joined' by updating their leave_time and calculating final duration. Explain the processFinalAttendance function call that determines attendance status (present, partial, absent) for all enrolled students based on their participation duration. Document the transaction flow, including duration calculation in seconds and the MIN_ATTENDANCE_DURATION threshold (15 minutes). Address error handling and edge cases such as meetings ending without participants or with incomplete data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend architecture of the School-Management-System. Describe the component-based design using Next.js App Router with server and client components. Document the UI component architecture leveraging shadcn/ui primitives and custom business components in the components/ directory. Explain the state management strategy using Zustand stores for global state like authentication and notifications. Detail the routing structure with role-based access control and nested layouts. Cover the styling approach using Tailwind CSS with a custom theme and CSS variables. Include information about layout components, data fetching patterns using React Server Components, and client-side interactivity. Provide system context diagrams showing component composition and data flow. Address cross-cutting concerns like responsive design, accessibility, and performance optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the styling architecture of the School-Management-System. Detail the implementation of Tailwind CSS 4 with a custom configuration and design system. Explain the theme management system using CSS variables and the theme-provider.tsx component for dynamic theme switching. Document the global styles setup in globals.css files and the integration with Next.js. Describe the process of extending the design system through components.json for shadcn/ui component customization. Cover the responsive design approach using Tailwind's breakpoint system and accessibility considerations in color contrast and spacing. Provide examples of common styling patterns used throughout the application and guidelines for maintaining visual consistency. Include instructions for adding new theme variants and customizing component appearances while adhering to the established design language.

wiki_catalogs.name: Parent Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Parent Monitoring system focused on its function in allowing parents to track their children's academic progress. Explain the implementation of features including grade viewing, attendance monitoring, calendar access, announcement reading, and meeting participation. Describe the data access patterns that enable parents to view multiple children's information through the parent-store state management. Document the integration with backend services via API routes in app/api/parent/ directory, particularly for child data retrieval. Include usage examples such as viewing a child's recent grades, checking attendance records, or registering for a parent-teacher meeting. Highlight the security considerations in data access control to ensure parents only see their linked children's information. Address common issues parents might encounter, such as missing data or connection problems, and provide resolution steps. Discuss the user experience design for multi-child households and data visualization techniques for academic trends.

wiki_catalogs.name: Supabase Migrations and Database Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Supabase database schema defined in the migrations directory. Detail each major table creation script: users, classes, attendance, grades, quizzes, lessons, schedule, and Zoom meetings. Explain the use of Row Level Security (RLS) policies in files like secure_rls.sql and strict_rls.sql to enforce role-based access at the database level. Document security hardening practices including rate limiting (rate_limit_table.sql), session security (session_security.sql), and IP address hashing. Describe the evolution of the schema through migration timestamps and versioning strategy. Include examples of how RLS policies in add_admin_read_all_users.sql enable admin access while restricting others. Address data integrity constraints, indexes for performance, and real-time subscription security in secure_realtime_rls.sql.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit Logging
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on audit logging in the School-Management-System. Thoroughly explain the audit logging system that tracks critical user actions and system events. Document the implementation of the `audit_logs` table and associated views like `audit_logs_view_v2.sql`. Include examples from API routes that generate audit entries for user management, grade changes, and attendance updates. Explain how IP addresses are hashed for privacy preservation using `hashIpAddress` utility. Describe the export functionality for compliance reporting and statistical analysis endpoints. Address common issues such as log volume management, retention policies, and querying historical data. Provide guidance on monitoring suspicious activities and integrating audit logs with security incident response.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the authentication and session management system. Explain the complete authentication flow from login via POST /api/auth/login to session creation and token management using Supabase Auth. Document the role-based access control implementation, including how user roles (admin, teacher, student, parent) are validated in middleware. Describe the session security mechanisms including fingerprinting, timeout handling via use-session-timeout.ts, and protection against session hijacking. Explain the /api/auth/me endpoint for retrieving current user context and /api/check-auth for session validation. Cover MFA implementation in app/auth/mfa/ and password change workflows. Include security considerations like secure cookie handling, CSRF protection, and audit logging of authentication events.

wiki_catalogs.name: Parent API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the Parent API endpoints. Cover child relationship management (children), academic monitoring (child/[id]/grades, child/[id]/attendance), and communication (announcements). For each endpoint, document HTTP methods, URL structures, request/response payloads using lib/supabase/types.ts, and authentication requirements (parent role validation with relationship verification). Explain the data access control mechanism that ensures parents can only view their linked children's information through proper JOIN queries and RLS policies. Detail the response structure for grade and attendance data, including historical trends and recent updates. Include error handling for unauthorized access attempts and rate limiting configurations. Provide integration examples from parent dashboard components like parent-store.tsx and progress-analytics.tsx. Document the security model that prevents enumeration of unlinked students.

wiki_catalogs.name: Interactive Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for interactive UI components that handle user actions and dynamic content presentation. Document dialog and alert-dialog implementations for critical actions, including confirmation flows. Explain dropdown-menu and popover for contextual actions in tables and lists. Describe tabs for content organization in dashboards. Detail zoom-meeting-dialog and session-timeout-modal for real-time interaction handling. Include event handling patterns, animation transitions, and accessibility considerations like focus trapping and ARIA roles. Provide usage examples from actual features like meeting registration or session management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Grade Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Grade model in the School-Management-System. Detail the field definitions including id, student_id, class_id, score, max_score, percentage, grade, type (exam, quiz, assignment, project), date, and created_at with their respective data types and constraints. Explain the primary key (id) and foreign key relationships to users (student_id) and classes (class_id). Document the RLS policies that govern grade visibility based on user roles (students see their own, teachers see their classes, admins see all). Describe the relationship between grades and other entities such as assignments, quizzes, and grading calculations. Include the TypeScript interface DbGrade from lib/supabase/types.ts and the corresponding database schema from lib/database.types.ts. Explain business rules for grade calculation, weighting, and final grade computation. Provide examples of queries for student grade reports, class performance analytics, and grade history tracking. Address data validation rules and audit requirements for grade changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Grade Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Grade Monitoring sub-feature of the Admin Dashboard. Document the data flow from Supabase grades table through API routes to the frontend grades page, including loading states and error handling. wiki_catalogs.name: Quiz Creation and Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Quiz Creation and Management feature in the Teacher Portal. wiki_catalogs.name: Quiz Taking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Quiz Taking sub-feature, detailing how students initiate and complete online quizzes. Document the state management during quiz execution, including time limits and prevention of multiple submissions. wiki_catalogs.name: Parent Dashboard
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Parent Dashboard section. Detail key features: viewing child grades through grades/page.tsx, tracking attendance records, reading school announcements, scheduling parent-teacher meetings, and accessing the academic calendar. Explain how the dashboard fetches data via parent-specific API routes such as parent/child/[id]/grades/route.ts and parent/children/route.ts. wiki_catalogs.name: State Management Stores
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive content for the Zustand-based state management system used to manage global application state. wiki_catalogs.name: Security Infrastructure: RLS, Rate Limiting, and Session Security
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the security infrastructure, covering Row Level Security (RLS), rate limiting, and session security. Detail how RLS policies in secure_rls.sql and security_hardening.sql enforce fine-grained access control across tables like users, grades, and attendance. Explain the rate_limit_table.sql implementation that tracks request counts and prevents abuse, including its integration with API routes. Document the secure_realtime_rls.sql policies that protect real-time subscriptions from unauthorized access. Describe the session_security.sql mechanisms that manage session validity, detect anomalies, and enforce re-authentication when necessary. Include examples of how these security layers interact with application logic in lib/supabase/middleware.ts and API routes like app/api/auth/login/route.ts. Address threat models, performance implications, and best practices for maintaining a secure database layer in a multi-tenant school environment.

wiki_catalogs.name: Parent API Endpoints

wiki_catalogs.name: Grades Management

wiki_catalogs.name: Attendance API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the Student Attendance API endpoints. Reference the ActiveSessions component that consumes this API and the underlying database queries in Supabase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the security implementation in the Zoom webhook integration. Explain the HMAC-SHA256 signature verification using x-zm-signature and x-zm-request-timestamp headers against ZOOM_WEBHOOK_SECRET. Document the importance of the URL validation challenge handling before signature verification. Describe additional security measures such as IP address hashing in database (evident from migrations), environment variable protection, and error handling that prevents information leakage. Include best practices for securing webhook endpoints, rotating secrets, and monitoring unauthorized access attempts. Reference the security hardening migrations in supabase/migrations/ that support this implementation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Considerations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on security in the School-Management-System. Document the multi-layered security approach starting with authentication using Supabase Auth with MFA support and session management. Explain the Row Level Security implementation in PostgreSQL with over 50 migration files enforcing strict access controls. Detail the API security measures including rate limiting, input validation, and secure error handling. Cover session security features like timeout management and active session monitoring. Explain the audit logging system that tracks critical user actions and system events. Document data protection measures including IP address hashing and secure storage policies. Include information about security headers, CSP policies, and protection against common vulnerabilities. Provide threat models for key features and mitigation strategies. Reference the SECURITY.md policy document and its implementation in the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit & Security API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the audit logging and security monitoring endpoints in the School-Management-System. Cover routes for retrieving audit logs (GET /api/audit-logs), exporting log data (export), and retrieving analytics (stats). For each endpoint, specify HTTP method, filtering parameters, response format (including timestamp, user, action, IP hash), and access controls (admin-only). Provide examples of querying logs for user activity or system changes. Explain the underlying data model defined in supabase/migrations/audit_logs_view_v2.sql and how events are captured via database triggers and application-level logging. Detail integration with lib/audit-monitor.ts for real-time monitoring and alerting. Address privacy considerations including IP address hashing in 20260110000003_hash_ip_addresses.sql and data retention policies. Discuss performance optimization for large log datasets and export formats supported.

wiki_catalogs.name: Announcements and Communications
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create documentation for the announcements table, including fields: id, title, content, author_id, target_audience (all/students/parents/teachers), created_at, and updated_at. Explain how announcements are distributed based on role and class enrollment. Document RLS policies that allow admins and teachers to create announcements, and all users to read relevant announcements based on their role and audience targeting. Describe the API flow for creating, deleting, and retrieving announcements. Include how announcements are displayed in role-specific dashboards and how real-time updates are handled via Supabase subscriptions. Address data retention policies and soft delete patterns if implemented.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the backend API endpoints of the School-Management-System. Document all RESTful endpoints organized by role (admin, teacher, student, parent) and functional domain (users, classes, attendance, grades, assignments, etc.). For each endpoint, specify HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas using types from lib/supabase/types.ts and lib/zoom/types.ts, authentication requirements, and example payloads. Include detailed descriptions of error responses and status codes. Document the API versioning strategy and backwards compatibility considerations. Cover the authentication endpoints for login, logout, and session management. Explain the integration endpoints for Zoom meeting management and reporting. Provide client implementation guidelines, rate limiting policies, and performance optimization tips for API consumers. Include examples of common API usage patterns from the frontend codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Zoom Meeting Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the zoom_meetings and meeting_registrants tables that support virtual class sessions. For zoom_meetings, detail fields: id, class_id, zoom_meeting_id, start_url, join_url, status, scheduled_start, and duration. For meeting_registrants, include meeting_id, user_id, join_time, leave_time, and attendance_status. Explain how meetings are linked to academic classes and how registrants are enrolled automatically. Document RLS policies that allow teachers to create meetings for their classes, students to join their enrolled meetings, and admins to view all meeting data. Describe the integration with the Zoom API, webhook handling, and how attendance is synchronized. Include performance considerations for large meetings and data privacy with IP hashing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the database schema of the School-Management-System. Detail all major entities including Users, Classes, Attendance, Grades, Assignments, Lessons, Schedule, and Parent-Child relationships. For each entity, document field definitions, data types, primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints as defined in the migration files. Explain the business rules and validation logic enforced at the database level. Include database schema diagrams showing entity relationships and cardinality. Document the Row Level Security policies that govern data access for each table. Explain the data lifecycle, retention policies, and archival rules. Cover the type definitions in lib/supabase/types.ts and lib/database.types.ts that provide TypeScript interfaces for the database schema. Address data migration strategies and version management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audit Logging and Security Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the audit_logs table and related security infrastructure. Detail fields: id, user_id, action (create/update/delete), entity_type, entity_id, old_values, new_values, ip_address (hashed), user_agent, and created_at. Explain how critical actions like user status changes, grade modifications, and account linking are logged. Document the RLS policies that restrict audit log access to admins only. Describe the rate limiting system using the rate_limit table to prevent abuse. Include how audit logs are queried for security monitoring, exported via the export endpoint, and visualized in the admin dashboard. Address data retention, indexing for performance, and compliance with privacy regulations.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the UI component library of the School-Management-System. Describe the component architecture based on shadcn/ui primitives extended with custom business components. Document key component categories including layout components (dashboard header, sidebar), data display components (tables, cards, charts), form components (inputs, selects, file upload), and interactive components (dialogs, dropdowns, tabs). For each significant component, detail props/attributes, events, slots, and customization options. Include usage examples with code snippets from actual implementation. Provide guidelines for responsive design and accessibility compliance (WCAG). Document the theming system and style customization options. Address component composition patterns and integration with state management. Include performance optimization tips for component usage and rendering.

wiki_catalogs.name: Developer Onboarding Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on developer onboarding for the School-Management-System. Provide step-by-step instructions for setting up the development environment including required software (Node.js, pnpm, Supabase CLI). Document the installation process using package managers and dependency resolution. Explain how to configure environment variables using the .env.example template. Provide detailed instructions for running the application in development mode, including database setup with Supabase and migration application. Cover the testing strategy and how to run tests. Document the code contribution guidelines including branching strategy, commit conventions, and pull request process. Include troubleshooting tips for common setup issues like database connection errors or authentication problems. Provide a quick start checklist for new developers to become productive immediately.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Overview: LessonGo - School Management System

## 1. Project Introduction

LessonGo is a modern, comprehensive school management system designed to streamline educational administration and enhance the learning experience for all stakeholders. The platform provides role-based dashboards for administrators, teachers, students, and parents, creating a unified ecosystem for school management.

**Purpose Statement**: To provide an integrated digital platform that simplifies school operations, improves communication between stakeholders, and enhances educational outcomes through data-driven insights.

**Core Goals and Objectives**:
- Centralize school management functions into a single, intuitive platform
- Provide real-time access to academic performance and attendance data
- Facilitate seamless communication between teachers, students, and parents
- Implement secure, role-based access control for data privacy
- Enable data-driven decision making through comprehensive analytics

**Target Audience**:
- School administrators and staff
- Teachers and instructors
- Students across grade levels
- Parents and guardians
- Educational institutions of various sizes

## 2. Technical Architecture

The LessonGo system follows a modern full-stack architecture built on Next.js with a clear separation of concerns between frontend, API routes, and backend services.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[Next.js App Router]
    B --> C[API Routes]
    C --> D[Supabase Database]
    D --> E[(PostgreSQL)]
    B --> F[Supabase Client]
    F --> D
    C --> G[Zoom Integration]
    B --> H[State Management]
    H --> I[Zustand Stores]
    style A fill:#4ECDC4,stroke:#333
    style B fill:#45B7D1,stroke:#333
    style C fill:#96CEB4,stroke:#333
    style D fill:#FFEAA7,stroke:#333
    style E fill:#F7DC6F,stroke:#333
    style F fill:#DDA0DD,stroke:#333
    style G fill:#BB8FCE,stroke:#333
    style H fill:#AED6F1,stroke:#333
    style I fill:#A9CCE3,stroke:#333
```

The architecture follows a component-based design with the Next.js App Router serving as the foundation. The system leverages Supabase for database operations with Row Level Security (RLS) policies ensuring data isolation between users. API routes in the `app/api` directory handle server-side logic, while client components interact with these endpoints to provide a seamless user experience.

The frontend employs a modular component architecture with reusable UI elements from shadcn/ui, custom business components, and role-specific dashboards. State management is handled through Zustand stores for global state and React hooks for component state.

Sources:
- [README.md](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/README.md)
- [package.json](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/package.json)

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `app/page.tsx`: Home page with authentication state management
- `app/layout.tsx`: Root layout with theme provider and global components
- Role-specific dashboards: `app/admin/page.tsx`, `app/teacher/page.tsx`, `app/student/page.tsx`, `app/parent/page.tsx`

### Core Modules
- **Authentication**: Implemented through Supabase auth with role-based access
- **Dashboard System**: Role-specific dashboards with relevant metrics and actions
- **API Layer**: Server-side routes in `app/api` for secure data access
- **State Management**: Zustand stores in `lib/` for global application state
- **UI Components**: Reusable components in `components/` directory

### Configuration Approach
- Environment variables in `.env.example` for configuration
- Next.js configuration in `next.config.mjs`
- Tailwind CSS configuration in `tailwind.config.js`
- TypeScript configuration in `tsconfig.json`
- Supabase migrations in `supabase/migrations/` for database schema management

### External Dependencies
- **Next.js 16**: React framework with App Router
- **Supabase**: Backend-as-a-service with PostgreSQL database
- **Zustand**: State management
- **shadcn/ui**: Component library
- **Tailwind CSS**: Styling
- **TypeScript**: Type safety
- **Zoom**: Virtual classroom integration

### Integration Points
- **Supabase**: Primary database and authentication
- **Zoom**: Virtual classroom and meeting integration
- **Vercel Analytics**: Usage tracking
- **OpenAI**: AI assistant functionality (optional)

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Frontend] --> B[Next.js App]
    B --> C[API Routes]
    C --> D[Supabase]
    C --> E[Zoom]
    D --> F[PostgreSQL Database]
    E --> G[Zoom API]
    B --> H[State Stores]
    H --> I[Analytics]
    H --> J[User Preferences]
    style A fill:#4ECDC4,stroke:#333
    style B fill:#45B7D1,stroke:#333
    style C fill:#96CEB4,stroke:#333
    style D fill:#FFEAA7,stroke:#333
    style E fill:#BB8FCE,stroke:#333
    style F fill:#F7DC6F,stroke:#333
    style G fill:#D7BDE2,stroke:#333
    style H fill:#AED6F1,stroke:#333
    style I fill:#A9CCE3,stroke:#333
    style J fill:#85C1E9,stroke:#333
```

Sources:
- [app/page.tsx](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/app/page.tsx)
- [app/layout.tsx](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/app/layout.tsx)
- [package.json](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/package.json)

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
LessonGo offers a comprehensive suite of features designed to address the needs of modern educational institutions:

- **Role-Based Dashboards**: Customized interfaces for administrators, teachers, students, and parents
- **Assignment System**: Create, submit, and grade assignments with file uploads
- **Parent Portal**: Monitor children's academic progress and communicate with teachers
- **Calendar Integration**: School-wide calendar with iCal export support
- **Progress Analytics**: Visual grade trends, attendance patterns, and performance insights
- **QR Attendance**: Quick check-in with location verification
- **Real-time Communication**: In-app messaging and announcements
- **AI Assistant**: Educational support powered by OpenAI
- **Virtual Classes**: Integrated Zoom functionality for online learning

### Implementation Highlights
- **Secure Data Access**: Row Level Security (RLS) policies in Supabase ensure users can only access appropriate data
- **Real-time Updates**: Supabase real-time subscriptions for live data updates
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first approach with responsive layouts
- **Accessibility**: Semantic HTML and ARIA attributes for accessibility
- **Performance Optimization**: Next.js features like server-side rendering and static generation

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Authentication
    Authentication --> Home: Successful login
    Authentication --> Login: Need to sign in
    
    Home --> AdminDashboard: User is admin
    Home --> TeacherDashboard: User is teacher
    Home --> StudentDashboard: User is student
    Home --> ParentDashboard: User is parent
    
    AdminDashboard --> UserManagement: Manage users
    AdminDashboard --> Analytics: View system analytics
    AdminDashboard --> Settings: Configure system settings
    
    TeacherDashboard --> ClassManagement: Manage classes
    TeacherDashboard --> GradeStudents: Record grades
    TeacherDashboard --> TakeAttendance: Record attendance
    TeacherDashboard --> CreateMeeting: Schedule Zoom meeting
    
    StudentDashboard --> ViewGrades: Check grades
    StudentDashboard --> SubmitAssignment: Submit work
    StudentDashboard --> QRCheckin: Check in via QR code
    StudentDashboard --> JoinMeeting: Join Zoom class
    
    ParentDashboard --> MonitorChild: View child's progress
    ParentDashboard --> MessageTeacher: Contact teachers
    ParentDashboard --> ViewCalendar: Check school calendar
    
    Authentication --> [*]: Logout
    AdminDashboard --> [*]: Logout
    TeacherDashboard --> [*]: Logout
    StudentDashboard --> [*]: Logout
    ParentDashboard --> [*]: Logout
```

The system implements a robust security model with role-based access control, ensuring that users can only access data and functionality appropriate to their role. The API routes in the `app/api` directory serve as the gateway between the frontend and data sources, implementing security checks and business logic.

The parent portal feature allows parents to monitor multiple children's progress through a unified interface, with the ability to switch between children and view their respective academic data. The analytics system provides visual representations of grade trends, attendance patterns, and performance metrics, enabling data-driven insights for all stakeholders.

Sources:
- [README.md](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/README.md)
- [app/admin/page.tsx](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/app/admin/page.tsx)
- [app/teacher/page.tsx](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/app/teacher/page.tsx)
- [app/student/page.tsx](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/app/student/page.tsx)
- [app/parent/page.tsx](/media/protech/New Volume/Projects/School-Management-System/app/parent/page.tsx)
</blog>
